definitions: minister in charge of a Christian church or congregation
spiritual guide who provides religious counsel and pastoral care to members
examples: The pastor delivered an inspiring sermon about forgiveness
Our church hired a new pastor from the theological seminary
She sought advice from her pastor during difficult times
The pastor visited sick members of the congregation regularly

definitions: artistic work depicting idealized country life and shepherds
poem or play set in countryside featuring shepherds and rustic themes
official letter from a bishop to clergy or congregation
examples: The museum displayed several pastoral paintings from the Renaissance
She collected pastoral landscapes featuring sheep and rolling hills
Milton wrote pastorals celebrating the beauty of rural life
The pastoral depicted simple shepherds discussing philosophy
The bishop issued a pastoral addressing contemporary moral issues
Churches read the pastoral letter during Sunday services

definitions: position or tenure of service as a pastor
body of people under the spiritual care of a pastor
examples: His pastorate lasted twenty years at the same church
She began her pastorate immediately after seminary graduation
The entire pastorate gathered for the anniversary celebration
He ministered to a pastorate of five hundred families

definitions: sweet baked food made with flour, fat, and water
dough mixture used as base for pies, tarts, and other baked goods
examples: The bakery window displayed colorful pastries and croissants
She ordered coffee and a Danish pastry for breakfast
Roll the pastry thin before placing it in the pie dish
The chef prepared puff pastry for the appetizers

definitions: land covered with grass suitable for grazing animals
right to graze animals on particular land or payment for this
examples: The ranch included five hundred acres of prime pasturage
Sheep thrived on the mountain's natural pasturage
Farmers negotiated pasturage fees with the landowner
Medieval commons provided free pasturage for villagers' livestock

definitions: field covered with grass where livestock graze
grass and plants that grazing animals eat
examples: Cattle grazed peacefully in the green pasture
The farmer moved his sheep to fresh pasture
The pasture was rich with clover and timothy grass
Drought reduced the quality of available pasture

definitions: area of land devoted to or suitable for the grazing of livestock
examples: The estate converted cropland into productive pastureland
They purchased additional pastureland for their expanding herd
Prime pastureland commands high prices in cattle country
Overgrazing damaged much of the region's pastureland

definitions: savory pastry case with filling, traditionally from Cornwall
unhealthy pale appearance of skin
examples: The Cornish pasty contained beef, potato, and turnip
Miners carried pasties for lunch in the coal mines
His pasty complexion suggested he needed more sunlight
After the illness, she looked pasty and exhausted

definitions: light touch or tap with the hand
small flat portion of butter or similar substance
examples: She gave the dog an affectionate pat on the head
The teacher's encouraging pat boosted his confidence
Place a pat of butter on each serving
The restaurant served bread with individual pats of butter

definitions: piece of material used to repair a hole or strengthen a weak point
small area differing from its surroundings
update to computer software that fixes problems or adds features
examples: She sewed a patch over the torn knee
The tire needed a patch to fix the puncture
A patch of wildflowers grew beside the trail
Dark patches appeared on the aging painting
Download the latest patch to fix the security vulnerability
The game patch addressed several gameplay issues

definitions: act of mending or repairing with patches
process of making temporary repairs or improvements
examples: The patching of the roof took several hours
Road crews spent the morning patching potholes
Constant patching won't solve the underlying structural problems
The software requires regular patching for security

definitions: needlework consisting of pieces of different colored fabric sewn together
thing composed of many different elements forming a pattern
examples: Her grandmother made a beautiful patchwork quilt
The patchwork cushion featured vintage fabric scraps
The legislation was a patchwork of compromises
Fields created a patchwork pattern across the valley

definitions: person's head, especially the crown
paste or spread made from finely chopped meat or fish
examples: The sun beat down on his bald pate
He rubbed his sore pate after bumping the doorframe
The restaurant served duck pate with toast points
She spread chicken liver pate on crackers

definitions: exclusive right granted for an invention
government document conferring a right or title
examples: The company filed a patent for their new technology
Her patent protected the invention for twenty years
The land patent transferred ownership from the government
Historical patents reveal early territorial claims

definitions: person or organization that holds or has been granted a patent
examples: The patentee licensed the technology to several manufacturers
As patentee, she received royalties from product sales
Multiple patentees disputed ownership of the innovation
The original patentee sold rights to a larger corporation

definitions: practice of managing people in a fatherly way, providing for their needs but limiting freedom
examples: Corporate paternalism provided benefits but restricted worker autonomy
Critics argued the policy reflected outdated paternalism
Government paternalism sometimes conflicts with individual liberty
The colonial system operated through economic and social paternalism

definitions: state of being someone's father
origin or authorship of something
examples: The court ordered a test to establish paternity
He acknowledged paternity of the child
Scholars debate the paternity of several anonymous works
The paternity of the invention remained disputed

definitions: way or track laid down for walking
course or route along which something moves
trajectory of a moving object through space
examples: The garden path led to a hidden fountain
Joggers used the paved path through the park
The hurricane's path threatened coastal cities
She chose a difficult path through medical school
Scientists calculated the comet's path through the solar system
The bullet's path indicated the shooter's position

definitions: person who discovers new routes through unexplored territory
person who pioneers or innovates in a particular field
examples: Native American pathfinders guided the expedition westward
The pathfinder marked trees to create a trail
She was a pathfinder in women's education
Technology pathfinders shape future innovations

definitions: bacterium, virus, or other microorganism that can cause disease
examples: Laboratory tests identified the pathogen causing the outbreak
Antibiotics target bacterial pathogens but not viruses
The water treatment plant removes pathogens from drinking water
Emerging pathogens pose new challenges for public health

definitions: medical doctor who studies diseases through examination of organs, tissues, and bodily fluids
examples: The pathologist examined tissue samples for signs of cancer
Forensic pathologists determine causes of unexpected deaths
The pathologist's report confirmed the diagnosis
She trained as a pathologist specializing in pediatric diseases

definitions: scientific study of diseases and their causes, processes, and effects
typical behavior of a disease or condition
examples: She studied pathology at medical school
The pathology department analyzed the biopsy results
The pathology of addiction involves complex brain changes
Understanding cancer pathology helps develop treatments

definitions: track or path for walking
sequence of chemical reactions in living organisms
means of achieving something or course of development
examples: Stone pathways connected different areas of the garden
The pathway through the woods was overgrown
Researchers studied metabolic pathways in cancer cells
The neural pathway transmits signals to the brain
Education provides a pathway out of poverty
The company created new pathways for career advancement

definitions: capacity to accept delay, trouble, or suffering without becoming angry or upset
examples: Teaching young children requires enormous patience
Her patience with difficult customers impressed everyone
He lost patience after waiting two hours
Developing patience takes practice and self-control

definitions: person receiving medical treatment or care
card game for one player, also called solitaire
examples: The patient recovered quickly after surgery
Doctors consulted about the patient's treatment options
She played patient on her computer during breaks
The card game patient requires strategy and luck

definitions: green or brown film on copper or bronze surface produced by oxidation
sheen or quality acquired by something through age or use
examples: The statue developed a green patina over decades
Collectors value the natural patina on antique bronze
Years of use gave the leather a beautiful patina
The old building had acquired a patina of respectability

definitions: paved outdoor area adjoining a house used for dining or recreation
examples: They installed a barbecue grill on the patio
The restaurant's patio offered scenic mountain views
Potted plants decorated the sunny patio
We ate breakfast on the patio every morning

definitions: regional dialect differing from the standard language of a country
examples: The islanders spoke a French-based patois
Local patois made communication difficult for outsiders
Jamaican patois influenced reggae music lyrics
The patois contained words from several languages

definitions: male head of a family or tribal line
bishop of highest rank in certain Christian churches
respected elderly man who is a leader
examples: The patriarch made important decisions for the extended family
Four generations gathered to honor the family patriarch
The Orthodox patriarch led Easter services
Patriarchs from different churches met for dialogue
The village patriarch shared wisdom from decades of experience
He became the patriarch of the local business community

definitions: territory or churches under a patriarch's authority
office, dignity, or tenure of a patriarch
examples: The patriarchate included churches across three countries
Constantinople was an important historical patriarchate
His patriarchate lasted for twenty-five years
The patriarchate faced challenges from political changes

definitions: social system in which men hold primary power and predominate in leadership roles
examples: Feminists criticized the patriarchy's impact on women's opportunities
Traditional patriarchy assigned specific roles by gender
The patriarchy influenced laws and social customs
Many societies are moving away from strict patriarchy

definitions: aristocrat or nobleman, especially in ancient Rome
person of refined upbringing and manners
examples: Roman patricians held exclusive political rights
The patrician families controlled the senate
Her patrician bearing revealed her privileged background
The club maintained its patrician atmosphere

definitions: property inherited from one's father or male ancestor
heritage or legacy passed down through generations
examples: He squandered his patrimony on risky investments
The castle was part of the family's ancient patrimony
The museum preserves our national patrimony
Language forms part of our cultural patrimony

definitions: person who vigorously supports and defends their country
examples: Patriots fought for independence during the revolution
She considered herself a patriot who questioned government policies
The memorial honored patriots who died serving their country
True patriots work to improve their nation

definitions: devoted love, support, and defense of one's country
examples: His patriotism inspired him to join the military
Patriotism surged during the national crisis
Critics questioned whether dissent showed lack of patriotism
Schools taught patriotism through flag ceremonies

definitions: group of people or vehicles that monitor an area
act of moving through an area to monitor or protect
examples: The border patrol intercepted illegal crossings
A patrol discovered the break-in during rounds
Officers began their nightly patrol at sunset
Neighborhood watch volunteers organized regular patrols

definitions: police officer who patrols a specific area or beat
examples: The patrolman walked his beat through downtown
A patrolman responded to the emergency call
Several patrolmen were assigned to the parade route
The patrolman knew every shop owner on his beat

definitions: regular customer of a store, restaurant, or business
person who supports artists, writers, or institutions financially
saint regarded as a special guardian
examples: The restaurant's loyal patrons filled every table
Patrons received a discount on their birthdays
The wealthy patron commissioned paintings from local artists
Museum patrons funded the new exhibition
Saint Christopher is the patron of travelers
Each guild had its own patron saint

definitions: support given by customers to a business
financial support for arts, artists, or causes
power to make appointments to government positions
examples: The shop depended on local patronage to survive
They appreciated their customers' continued patronage
Royal patronage enabled many Renaissance artists
The charity operated through private patronage
Political patronage filled government offices with supporters
The patronage system rewarded party loyalty

definitions: person easily taken advantage of or blamed for something
examples: They made him the patsy for their failed scheme
Don't be a patsy for corporate wrongdoing
The innocent employee became the patsy in the scandal
Con artists look for patsies to exploit

definitions: rapid continuous talk, often used by entertainers or salespeople
quick light sounds like rain or footsteps
examples: The auctioneer's patter mesmerized the bidders
His sales patter convinced many customers
Rain patter on the roof lulled her to sleep
The patter of tiny feet announced the toddler's arrival

definitions: repeated decorative design on fabric or surface
regular and intelligible form or sequence
model or design used as a guide for making things
examples: The wallpaper featured a floral pattern
She chose fabric with a geometric pattern
Scientists noticed a pattern in the data
Weather patterns suggested an approaching storm
Use this pattern to cut the dress pieces
The software followed a specific design pattern

definitions: small flat cake of chopped food, especially meat
examples: The burger patty was grilled to perfection
She formed salmon patties from canned fish
Vegetarian patties offered a meat-free option
Each patty weighed exactly four ounces

definitions: presence of something only in small or insufficient quantities
examples: The paucity of evidence made prosecution difficult
There was a paucity of qualified candidates
The paucity of rainfall caused crop failures
Critics noted the paucity of originality in the work

definitions: very poor person dependent on charity or public welfare
examples: The law provided basic assistance for paupers
He went from prince to pauper after losing everything
Victorian paupers lived in workhouses
The economic crash turned millionaires into paupers

definitions: temporary stop in action or speech
break or gap in speaking or reading
examples: Let's take a pause before continuing the hike
The game went into pause while officials reviewed
Her dramatic pause emphasized the announcement
A pause in conversation made everyone uncomfortable

definitions: material used to create a hard flat surface for roads or paths
examples: The pave consisted of interlocking concrete blocks
Workers laid new pave along the sidewalk
Different types of pave suit different climate conditions
The decorative pave enhanced the garden's appearance

definitions: hard surface of a road or street
raised paved path for pedestrians beside a road
examples: The hot pavement burned through thin shoe soles
Cracks in the pavement needed immediate repair
Children drew chalk pictures on the pavement
Keep to the pavement when walking near traffic

definitions: light ornamental building in a park or garden
building at a sports ground for players and spectators
temporary structure for exhibitions or events
examples: The wedding reception was held in the garden pavilion
A Victorian pavilion stood beside the lake
Players changed in the cricket pavilion
The pavilion offered shade for spectators
Countries built pavilions for the world exposition
The festival pavilion housed vendor booths

definitions: material used to pave an area
process of laying pavement
examples: The decorative paving enhanced the patio's appearance
Stone paving lasted longer than concrete
The paving of the highway took six months
Paving operations closed the street temporarily
